titlestmt.titleproper: Guide to the John Kent Folmar's Collection on the Monongahela River Buffs Association, 1870-2015 AIS.2019.01
titlestmt.author: Ben Bowers / Casey Willison.

editionstmt.p: Folmar, John Kent; Monongahela River Buffs Associaiton; Monongahela River Steam Towboats; Monongahela Historical Society;

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using ArchivesSpace on 2024-07-08 17:25:52 -0400.
profiledesc.langusage: Description is written in: English, Latin script.

did.unittitle: John Kent Folmar Collection on the Monongahela River Buffs Association

physdesc.extent: 17 boxes (and some items in a drawer and a flag)

did.abstract: This collection contains materials, collected by John Kent Folmar, related to the Monongahela River Buffs Association as well as the subject of Monongahela riverboats broadly. The Monongahela River Buffs Association aspired to preserve the history of the vessels and sailors who traveled along the Monongahela River. Dr. John Kent Folmar is an emeritus professor from the University of California, California, Pennsylvania, as well as a former member and president of the Monongahela River Buffs Association from 1980-1981, as well as 1990-2015 in addition to editing The Voice of the Mon newsletter.

userestrict.head: Copyright
userestrict.p: All rights reserved. University of Pittsburgh.

processinfo.head: Processing Information
processinfo.p: The Monongahela River Steamboats Album sub-series was processed by Casey Willison on 5 September 2019. The rest of the collection was processed by Ben Bowers in 2022.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: John Kent Folmar's Collection on the Monongahela River Buffs Association, 1870-2015, AIS2019.01, Archives & Special Collections, University of Pittsburgh Library System

acqinfo.head: Acqusition Information
acqinfo.p: Gift of Dr. John Kent Folmar I on January 3, 2019.

bioghist.head: Biographical / Historical
bioghist.p: Dating back to late 18th century, the Monongahela Valley was a center of river boat production in what was then the American Northwest. After massive public works to make the Monongahela more navigable and facilitate westward-expansion, between 1811 and 1888, over 3,000 steam boats would be produced from various boatyards throughout the region. By the turn of the 20th century, river traffic was frequent and modestly safe, if not as popular a transportation method as the concurrently growing railroad network. The largest contribution of this industry in the 20th century was plying the waterways with barges loaded with coal to fuel the growing steel industry in Pittsburgh and beyond. In order to preserve this history, the Monongahela River Buffs Association was officially formed in Greensboro, Pennsylvania on May 9, 1978. The group went on to create a museum in 1986 in Monongahela, PA, focused on the Monongahela River as well as the sailors and vessels who worked on the river. In addition to the museum, the group hoped to more broadly preserve the history of the Monongahela River (as abbreviated as The Mon) and generate public interest in venturing out onto the river and protecting the river from pollution. Founding members included Ernest Gabler, a former deckhand/pilot of a river ferry, and Herman D. Bennett, who would go on to become the first editor of the group's newsletter, The Voice of the Mon. In 1986, the group moved to the second floor of the former Odd Fellows building in Monongahela, Pennsylvania. The group would stay there until they were forced to close in 2015 when a lack of attendance at the museum and there weren't enough members to keep the association going.

Dr. John Kent Folmar, an emeritus professor at California University of Pennsylvania, would take over as editor in 1981. Dr. Folmar would also become president of the group in 1990, serving both positions until 2015.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: Series I. Navigation Charts and Maps, c. 1929-1985
Series II. Newspaper Articles and Clippings, 1944-2007
Series III. Pamphlets and booklets (Printed materials), 1934-2006
Series VI. Record Books from Vessel, 1948-1972
Series VIII. The Voice of the Mon Newsletters, 1979-2015
Series XI. United States Steel and Organized Labor Unions, 1923-1992

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content Note
scopecontent.p: This collection is made up of navigational charts, printed materials, photographs, scrapbooks, postcards, The Voice of the Mon newsletters newsletters and DVDs of video interviews collected by John Kent Folmar, predominantly in association with the Monongahela River Buffs Association.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This series contains navigation charts, primarily for the Ohio, Allegheny, and Monongahela rivers. The charts are a mix of bound and blueprint formats, as well as a poster map of Pittsburgh Harbor.

did.unittitle: Chart No. 186 – Ohio River: Pitt to Mouth (1911-14)
Chart no. 232 – Ohio River: Pitt to Mouth (1911-14) Wabash Island Bar Location of Dredge Cut
Chart No. 234 – Ohio River: Pitt to Mouth (1911-14) Raleigh Bar Dredge Cut
Chart No. 243 – Ohio River: Pitt to Mouth (1911-14)
Chart No. 244 – Ohio River: Pitt to Mouth (1911-14)
Chart No. 244 – Ohio River: Pitt to Mouth (1911-14) Walkers Bar Location of Dredge Cut
Chart No. 249 – Ohio River: Pitt to Mouth (1911-14) Pryors Island Dredge Cut
Chart no. 250 – Ohio River: Pitt to Mouth (1911-14) Sisters Island Bar Location of Dredge Cut
Navigational Chart, Ohio River – Pittsburgh, Pennsylvania to Powhatan Point, Ohio
Navigational Chart, Ohio River – Pittsburgh, Pennsylvania to Powhatan Point, Ohio
Navigational Chart, Ohio River – Powhatan Point, Ohio to Foster, Kentucky
Navigational Chart, Ohio River – Powhatan Point, Ohio to Foster, Kentucky

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Newspaper clippings, primarily from Pittsburgh-based newspapers, related to the Monongahela River, riverboats, events related to the river such as the Lewis and Clark Expedition and the 1949 Steamboat Race, river infrastructure such as locks, dams, and bridges, and articles relating to the history the river, boats, and towns along the river.

did.unittitle: 1949 Steamboat Race Between Homestead and William Larimer Jones, Pittsburgh
Always a River: The Ohio River and the American Experience (Exhibit) Pittsburgh Post-Gazette Articles

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This series contains printed material related to the Monongahela, Allegheny, and Ohio rivers, as well as the ships and captains which may be found on them. This includes promotional materials for shipbuilders such as Dravo Corporation and Hillman Barge and Construction Company, issues of various magazines and other publications, rules for ship pilots, and a program from the launching of the B.F. Fairless towboat.

did.unittitle: American Steamboat Album by Captain Frederick Way Jr.
Carnegie Steel Company – Voyage Number 100 program
Dravo Corporation, Program for the Launching of the B.F. Fairless towboat

unittitle.title: Fast Lines: Getting Places During the Years 1800-1880

did.unittitle: Hillman Barge and Construction Company Promotional Materials
James Rees & Sons Company shipbuilding illustrated catalog
Jones & Laughlin Steel Corporation Promotional Materials
List of Coal Mines, Landings and Towns of the Monongahela & Allegheny

unittitle.title: Regulations Governing the Admission of Candidates into the United States Naval Academy as Midshipmen and Sample Examination Papers
Specimen Examination Questions for Licenses as Master, Mate, and Pilot of Central Western Rivers Vessels

did.unittitle: St. Louis Shipbuilding – Federal Barge, Inc. Promotional Materials
The American Waterways Operators, Inc. Promotional Materials
The Artist Looks at Industrial Pittsburgh (Exhibit) program
The Steamer Sprague by Jack Custer
U.S. Army Corps. of Engineers publications related to the Monongahela
Various rulebooks for Pilots, Masters, and Mates

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Photographs, primarily of riverboats, but also of river scenes (such as a festival or the aftermath of a flood). If photographs were originally in the same photo album, there are kept together as a subseries/folder. All of the loose photos have been arranged into additional subseries based on the type of vessel.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Digital images printed out on paper. Many of the images are scans of historical photographs.

did.unittitle: Oil Wells, Brownsville, Pennsylvania covered bridge, and Lewis and Clark celebration bound digital prints

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: The photographs were in photo album pages within an unlabeled white binder. A note inside the binder identified 10 as "Elizabeth's 100th Anniversary" and the rest had more generic categories (steam towboats, tour/towboats, & POMEROY, O. FLOOD – 1937).

did.unittitle: A.B. Sheets and U.S. Steel Excursion Barge

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: The photographs were originally in a 3-ring binder. They have been arranged alphabetically into folders by the vessel name.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: The photos were inside of a photo album labeled "Odds & Ends: Monongahela and Elsewhere" on the front cover. There is a mix of color photos from circa 1974 as well as some black and white photos from the 1930s and earlier. The majority of the color photos depict towboats and barges whereas the black and white photos mainly depict various locks, steamboats, and dredge crews.

did.unittitle: Souvenir booklet of images from Pittsburgh, Pennsylvania

scopecontent.head: Scopes and Contents
scopecontent.p: This is a bound set of 82 images (printed on the front and back of each page) from the Pittsburgh area, dating from the early 1900s. The back cover has a red label which reads "W.A. MC-CORMICK." Inside the back cover, there is also a cursive, handwritten note that reads "Souvenir of Pittsburg [sic] From [illegible] F Beek [or possibly Beck]."

did.unittitle: Souvenir booklet of images from Pittsburgh, Pennsylvania

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Photographs of various vessels and various scenes, primarily on the Monongahela, Allegheny, Ohio, and Mississippi Rivers. Photographs are sorted by the name of the vessel or scene. If a diesel towboat and steamboat both had the same name, they were split into two folders.

did.unittitle: Captain Anthony Comer memorial photo album
Carnegie-Illinois Steel Corporation steamboat captains raising a World War II Treasury Department War Bonds "T" Flag
Maxwell Locks and Dam, Monongahela River Flood
Maxwell Locks and Dam, Monongahela River Flood
Mon River Towing Inc. photo album
Unidentified Diesel Towboat pushing a Commercial Barge Lines car barge
Unidentified man building a steamship model
Wheeling, West Virginia, Bridge over icy river and barge

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Photo album with "Property of William Dickie" written inside the front and back cover. All photos are black and white and depict riverboats. Boats pictured include Becky Thatcher, C. Sutherland, Champion Coal, Charles Rock, Clairton, Clyde, Crucible, Delta Queen, Duquesne, E.K. Davison, Edgar Thomson, Homestead, James E. Lose, Juniata, Leona, Lone Star, Miss Sterling, Pansy, Prosperity, Rezistal, Sailor, Thomas Moses, Titan, Vesta, and W.P. Snyder Jr. There are also a few loose photographs of the sunken Clairton and the attempt to raise it as well a newspaper clipping of the sinking of the Elizabeth M and scans of other photographs that were tucked inside the front cover.

did.unittitle: William L. Hood Photographs and Negatives

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Photographs and negatives believed to be taken by or of William L. Hood. The black and white photographs are inside of a cellophane envelope with "Billy Hood" written on it. They depict various scenes in Tennessee, Florida, and an unidentified Atlantic Ocean beach. Additionally, there is a small portrait with "William L. Hood" written on the back. The negatives are not of the same photographs. The negatives depict people, primarily children and an unidentified couple, along with an unidentified monument.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This series consists of postcards that depict Pennsylvania and Monongahela River related scenes. Most were originally sorted by geographic location (although, sometimes it was broad, such as "PA Scenes"). In order to aid access, the postcards are now sorted alphabetically by the town they depict, regardless of state. In cases where a town is not listed, a different geographic or topical name is used.

did.unittitle: B.F. Fairless steamboat at Elizabeth, Pennsylvania
City of Wheeling steamboat at Wheeling, West Virginia
G.A. Boeckling ferry, Cedar Point, Sandusky, Ohio
Irvin Works of Carnegie-Illinois Steel, Pennsylvania
Steamer Admiral at St. Louis, Missouri
Steamer St. Paul at Alton, Illinois
The Larry-Don Excursion Boat at Lake of the Ozarks, Missouri

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This series contains artifacts in the form of buttons from political campaigns, but it also includes a number of other types of buttons. Additionally, there is a flag from a J&L Steel ship.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: A collection of buttons, primarily for political campaigns. Political buttons are sorted by the type of race they were used in. Buttons for some presidential campaigns were separated into their own folders because there was a higher volume of buttons related to that particular person/campaign or the race is particularly notable, such as the Mondale-Ferrero race being the first major party ticket to feature a female Vice-Presidential candidate. Folders related to a specific campaign may include reproduction buttons. In addition to the political campaign buttons, there are other buttons which were sorted by theme.

did.unittitle: Pennsylvania Attorney General, District Attorney, and Supreme Court

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This subseries consists of one Jones & Laughlin Steel Corporation flag. The flag is green and yellow and displays the J&L logo.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: The first volume appears to be written descriptions of how to navigate various stretches of the Ohio River that was written aboard the Carnegie-Illinois Steel Company's Duquense steamboat in 1942. The second volume is a logbook from the Edgar Thomson steamboat from when the crew of the Duquense helped prepare the vessel to sail in February 1944 through the final entry on February 3, 1948. The third volume is a logbook for M.V. John H. Elliott, based on the stamp present on the first few pages. The logbook records its journey along the Monongahela River from February 6, 1967, to November 1, 1972.

scopecontent.head: Scopes and Contents
scopecontent.p: Seven scrapbooks containing photos and newspaper clippings of shipbuilders, riverboats, and sailors, primarily on the Monongahela River, as well as clippings related to the Monongahela River Buffs Association and its members. Additionally, there is another scrapbook that was disassembled into four separate folders.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Scrapbook containing a few photographs and many newspaper clippings related to the March 1936 Pittsburgh flood, also known as The Great St. Patrick's Day flood.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Scrapbook disassembled into four folder: Newspaper Clippings, Black & White Photographs, Color Photographs, and a Roster & Diary of the canoe trip down the Monongahela River on July 1-4, 1975. Originally, these materials were in a scrapbook, which has be disassembled. The trip was led by John Flower as a way to celebrate the bicentennial. The photographs consist of color and black and white shots of the canoe trip, including people dressing up as pioneers and Native Americans. The clippings are from local newspapers and also relate to the same trip.

did.unittitle: Scrapbook, Clippings from Waterways Journal, St. Louis, Missouri

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Articles and photos clipped out of Waterways Journal. The date range of articles appears to be from 1948 to 1950, although some refer to events from twenty or forty years prior. Articles center around riverboats, shipbuilders, and people associated with both from various rivers in the Midwest.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Scrapbook containing photos of diesel towboats clipped out of publications. The main owners of the boats pictured are Hillman, Guidry Towing Co., as well as other companies primarily operating out of the Midwest. Pictured vessels include Aaron J. Toups, Arkansas Explorer, Bayou Boeuf, Betty Joyce, Capt. Sam, David P. Guidry, Dennis W. Guidry, E.A. Gonsoulin, Elaine Jones, Explorer, Exxon Kentucky, Gnots IX, Itasca, Lagonda, Lewiston, Pearl Bellinger, Presque Isle, R Paul Guidry, Robert Crown, and Sea Islander.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Newspaper and Voice of the Mon clippings related to the Monongahela River, Ernie "Weenie" Gabler building ship models, and the Monongahela River Buffs Association. Additionally, there are photos of Gabler, as well as postcards from Binghamton, New York, brochures for historical places in the Greensboro, Pennsylvania region, photocopies of newspaper articles and photographs, and nautical stickers. The bulk of the clippings are from 1979-1990. The other materials are mostly undated.

did.unittitle: Scrapbook, Fortune Magazine Riverboat Clippings Scrapbook

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Newspaper clippings of steamboats, tug boats, and the Monongahela River pasted inside of a February 1947 copy of Fortune Magazine. Clippings are primarily from the late 1940s into the early 1950s. Inside the magazine itself, there is also an article entitled "Pittsburgh's New Power."

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Scrapbook containing photographs of riverboats and unidentified people, in addition to a few pieces of mail addressed to Mrs. Hendrickson (both "S.W." and "Ida M.") as well as a number of clippings featuring celebrities and pieces of advertisements. Pictured vessels include Aliquippa, Ashland, Atta Boy and the Majestic showboat, C.W. Talbot, Champion Coal, Charles R. Hook, Charles T. Campbell, Clairton, Commercial Clipper (Commercial Barge Lines Inc. car barge based out of Cincinnati, Ohio), Crescent, D.W. Wisherd, Delta Queen, E.D. Kenna, Ernest T. Weir, Esso Louisiana, Frank C. Rand, Gordon C. Greene, H.E. Lewis, Henry A. Laughlin, Island Queen, J.D. Ayres, Jefferson, Kenova, Louisiana, Mongah, O.F. Shearer, Omar, Patrick J. Hurley, Pittsburgh Coal, Renown, Robert F. Brandt, Sam P. Suit, Scioto, Taric, Thomas Moses, Tom Greene, Victory (Dravo), W.F. McCrady, W.H. Colvin Jr., W.P. Snyder Jr, Walter F. Carey, and Wm. B. Rodgers.

did.unittitle: Scrapbook, Monongahela River towns and vessels Scrapbook

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Newspaper and Voice of the Mon clippings related to Greensboro's Bicentennial, New Geneva, Brownsville, ships and bridges on the Monongahela River, barges sinking, and the Edmund Fitzgerald sinking.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Copies of The Voice of the Mon, the newsletter of the Monongahela Rivers Buffs Association. The newsletter was published from 1979 to 2015.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Papers related to various aspects of the Monongahela and Allegheny Rivers, as well as the riverboats and riverboat workers on them.

did.unittitle: H. R. 6479 – An Act to Provide for the Licensing of Personnel on Certain
James Rees & Sons Company Works print

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Papers related to United States Steel (including the companies that were absorbed to create US Steel, such as Carnegie Steel) and Organized Labor Unions related to steel working and more specifically, the riverboat workers connected to the steel industry.

did.unittitle: List of Eligible Voters, National Labor Relations Board

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This series contains video recordings conducted by John K. Folmar with various people who were employed with riverboat-related jobs as well as a former vice president of California University. The interviews are from 1984 to 1994 and are stored on DVDs.
